page.title: 07Farming-Bolton Road area
page.content: The farming of the area is basically livestock dependant on grass,which grows well.Hay and silage are cut for the main winter feed for the dairy cattle and the young beef cattle. The size of farm varies.Old Hall Farm has forty dairy cows on 90 acres. The three Spen Moor Farms have amalgamated to form a unit of 144 acres. The farms are mostly for dairy cattle. There is a unit at Pilkington Fold Farm which raises beef cattle on an intensive basis.A livery post has been developed to cater for the local horse riders. Many people think that this part of Lancashire is totaly urban,but much of the land is in fact given over to farming.
